title: 德國執政黨CDU政客求北京支援

replies.msg: https://www.spiegel.de/politik/deutschland/corona-krise-in-heinsberg-landrat-stephan-pusch-bittet-china-um-hilfe-a-84c1b1d7-dbc4-45a1-b30a-e626ba02e1ce?fbclid=IwAR1NaLsmVlFa4RGfzOrwLYDKfHFgqUou-BaB5G2Qa0gv6hT_rKHr5sNw8zY
有冇英文版？唔識睇德文

google translate頂住先

Heinsberger district administrator asks China for help

The North Rhine-Westphalian district of Heinsberg is particularly affected by the corona pandemic. The local district administrator is now appealing to Beijing.

Corona outbreak before, in Heinsberg it has long been there. Several people were infected at a carnival session, and the North Rhine-Westphalian district now has more than a thousand infected people and 21 dead.

The situation is extremely tense. The Heinsberg district administrator Stephan Pusch has now taken an unusual step - and turned to China in the crisis. The CDU politician asked Beijing for support with protective materials. The masks or protective gowns available in the circle were only sufficient for a few days, Pusch wrote in an open letter to the Chinese head of state and party leader Xi Jinping.

In the fight against the virus, those responsible in China have repeatedly emphasized the importance of adequate protective material, said Pusch in the letter addressed to the Chinese embassy in Berlin. "As far as the crisis team and the hospitals here cannot get enough protective materials - which is more than difficult - this would have far-reaching serious consequences for the health system in the district of Heinsberg and for the people here. In my function as district administrator, I therefore ask the People's Republic China for support, "the letter said.

Since physicians in China apparently also had the most experience in dealing with the containment and control of the corona virus, he would also be interested in a professional exchange of experience, writes Pusch. In addition, he can well imagine a partnership between the district and the Chinese province of Wuhan, which was particularly affected by the epidemic.

After severe criticism from the hospitals, the federal and state governments also want to improve the planned billion dollar package for the clinics in the corona crisis. The aid is part of an extensive rescue package that the cabinet in Berlin agreed on Monday.


However, the call for help to China shows how little trust in Heinsberg in support from home is. Pusch had already criticized the crisis management of his party friend Armin Laschet at the weekend in SPIEGEL. "We immediately closed schools and daycare centers, and I would have liked to see such a move earlier in the rest of the state," said the district administrator. Pusch also accused the Prime Minister of not taking the crisis seriously enough at the beginning. "We had the impression that you think: Okay, that's a problem in the Heinsberg district," said Pusch: "It hurt already."

德國可唔可以拎返納粹時期啲骨氣出嚟？唔會拎出嚟都犯法呱.
